hotels.name: Four Seasons Mexico City
hotels.desc: Luxury tower overlooking Paseo de la Reforma, fine dining, spa
hotels.longDesc: This iconic high-rise hotel commands views of Mexico City's skyline and historic landmarks while offering world-class service, a Michelin-starred restaurant, and spa facilities perfect for families.

hotels.name: St. Regis Mexico City
hotels.desc: Historic luxury hotel in Paseo de la Reforma with butler service
hotels.longDesc: A storied luxury beacon featuring butler service, refined dining, and impeccable craftsmanship—ideal for families seeking timeless elegance and attentive care in Mexico City's premier location.

hotels.name: Condesa DF
hotels.desc: Ultra-hip rooftop hotel in Roma-Condesa with panoramic views
hotels.longDesc: This cutting-edge design hotel in trendy Roma-Condesa offers a rooftop bar with sweeping city views, modern amenities, and proximity to the neighborhood's best restaurants—perfect for style-conscious families.

hotels.name: Downtown Mexico City
hotels.desc: Art Deco masterpiece converted to boutique hotel, historic center
hotels.longDesc: Set in a restored Art Deco building in the historic center, this intimate boutique hotel blends pre-Hispanic design elements with colonial architecture—an authentic cultural immersion in Mexico City's heart.

hotels.name: Casa Campos
hotels.desc: Charming boutique hotel in Roma Norte with rooftop terrace
hotels.longDesc: This Roma Norte gem combines colonial charm with modern comfort, perfect for families wanting to explore Mexico City's most vibrant culinary and cultural neighborhood from a stylish home base.

hotels.name: La Posada Tulum
hotels.desc: Beachfront eco-friendly resort with jungle access, cenotes
hotels.longDesc: An eco-conscious beachfront retreat that bridges jungle and sand, ideal for families seeking a balance of relaxation, adventure, and sustainability in Tulum's bohemian setting.

hotels.name: Habitas Oaxaca
hotels.desc: Luxury sustainable retreat near Oaxaca with farm, yoga, spa
hotels.longDesc: This boutique eco-luxury property near Oaxaca offers farm-to-table dining, yoga classes, and wellness programs—perfect for families wanting slow travel and authentic cultural immersion.

hotels.name: Azulik Tulum

hotels.longDesc: This visionary eco-resort merges art, ecology, and luxury in an immersive jungle setting, offering cenote access, holistic wellness, and a dining experience unlike any other—pure magic for adventurous families.

hotels.name: Rosewood Mayakoba
hotels.desc: Ultra-luxury beachfront resort in Riviera Maya with lagoons
hotels.longDesc: Set within a 1,600-acre nature reserve, this ultra-luxury resort features pristine beaches, mangrove lagoons, championship golf, and impeccable service—the ultimate Riviera Maya indulgence for families.

hotels.name: Las Ventanas al Paraíso
hotels.desc: All-suite ultra-luxury resort in Los Cabos with private beach

hotels.name: Palmaia The House of Aix

hotels.longDesc: This wellness-focused luxury sanctuary blends healing therapies, gourmet cuisine, yoga, and education—a transformative retreat for families seeking rejuvenation in paradise.

hotels.name: Mahekal Beach Resort

hotels.name: Papaya Playa Project

hotels.name: Belmond Casa de Sierra Nevada
hotels.desc: Colonial luxury villa in San Miguel de Allende with courtyards

hotels.name: Casa Angel Inn
hotels.desc: Intimate colonial-style inn in San Miguel de Allende
hotels.longDesc: This charming inn in San Miguel's historic center offers authentic colonial architecture, personalized service, and easy access to galleries, markets, and cultural attractions beloved by artistic families.

hotels.name: Misión Guanajuato

hotels.longDesc: Perched above Guanajuato's UNESCO-listed historic center, this luxury resort offers sunset views, fine dining, and proximity to silver mining heritage and vibrant cultural festivals for families.

hotels.name: Hotel Boutique Suites Playa del Carmen

hotels.longDesc: This ultra-exclusive 12-room beachfront boutique hotel in Tulum offers personalized service, privacy, and direct beach access—perfect for families seeking intimate luxury away from crowds.

hotels.name: La Zebra Tulum

hotels.name: Fusion Hotel Puerto Morelos

hotels.name: Casa Pescador Tulum

hotels.longDesc: This intimate beachfront property features rustic-chic cabanas, bohemian vibes, and direct beach access—authentic Tulum hospitality for families seeking laid-back, artsy escapes.

experiences.name: Templo Mayor
experiences.desc: Aztec temple complex in historic center, archaeological museum
experiences.longDesc: This remarkable Aztec temple complex, discovered beneath Mexico City, reveals layers of pre-Hispanic history and artistry that bring ancient civilizations vividly to life.

experiences.name: Frida Kahlo Museum (Casa Azul)
experiences.desc: Iconic blue house and museum, Frida's life and paintings

experiences.name: Museo de Antropología

experiences.longDesc: This magnificent museum houses Mexico's most important pre-Hispanic artifacts, including the iconic Aztec sun stone—essential for understanding ancient Mesoamerican civilizations.

experiences.longDesc: This iconic palace features stunning Diego Rivera murals depicting Mexican history and showcases colonial architecture—culturally essential for understanding modern Mexico.

experiences.name: Chichén Itzá

experiences.longDesc: One of the New World's most impressive Maya archaeological sites, featuring the iconic stepped pyramid El Castillo, combines stunning architecture with profound historical significance.

experiences.name: Tulum Ruins
experiences.desc: Clifftop Maya ruins overlooking Caribbean, walled city
experiences.longDesc: These dramatic Maya ruins perched on cliffs above turquoise Caribbean waters showcase pre-Hispanic architecture and engineering—unforgettable for history-loving families.

experiences.name: Cenote Swimming (Tulum)
experiences.desc: Crystal-clear underground cenote pools, geological wonder
experiences.longDesc: These natural limestone sinkholes with crystal-clear underground waters offer a uniquely refreshing and magical swimming experience—part geological wonder, part pure joy.

experiences.name: Teotihuacán
experiences.desc: Pre-Aztec pyramid complex, Pyramid of the Sun, Avenue of the Dead
experiences.longDesc: This pre-Aztec ceremonial complex features massive pyramids and sacred architecture that dominated Mesoamerica—spiritually powerful for families seeking ancient mysteries.

experiences.name: Museo de Frida Kahlo
experiences.desc: Casa Azul, artist's personal collection, biographical exhibitions
experiences.longDesc: This intimate museum in Frida's former home showcases her personal collection, artwork, and biographical materials—deeply moving for families appreciating artistic genius.

experiences.name: Castillo de Chapultepec
experiences.desc: Historic castle in Chapultepec Park, national museum
experiences.longDesc: This historic hilltop castle overlooks Mexico City and houses important museum collections—offering both history and panoramic views families cherish.

experiences.name: Palenque
experiences.desc: Maya ruins in jungle, elaborate stone carvings, mystical setting
experiences.longDesc: This mystical Maya city deep in Chiapas jungle showcases elaborate architecture and intricate stonework—profoundly spiritual for adventurous families.

experiences.name: Oaxaca Archaeological Sites
experiences.desc: Monte Albán, Mitla, pre-Hispanic cultures
experiences.longDesc: Oaxaca's surrounding archaeological zones reveal sophisticated pre-Hispanic cultures with distinctive architecture and artistic traditions—educational for curious families.

experiences.name: Monte Albán
experiences.desc: Pre-Hispanic Zapotec city ruins, hilltop location, terraced architecture
experiences.longDesc: This ancient Zapotec city on a flattened mountain showcases sophisticated pre-Hispanic architecture and urban planning—dramatically situated for exploring ancient wisdom.

experiences.name: Xochimilco
experiences.desc: Aztec floating gardens, colorful boats, island gardens
experiences.longDesc: These ancient Aztec floating gardens feature colorful traditional boats, island gardens, and waterways—magical and enchanting for families enjoying Mexico City day trips.

experiences.name: Mercado de Artesanías (Anthropology Museum Shop)
experiences.desc: Artisan crafts market, indigenous art, folk traditions
experiences.longDesc: This museum-affiliated market showcases authentic indigenous crafts and folk art traditions—perfect for families supporting artisans while discovering regional talents.

experiences.name: Mezcal Distillery Tours (Oaxaca)
experiences.desc: Artisanal mezcal production, distillery visits, tastings
experiences.longDesc: Oaxaca's mezcal distilleries offer fascinating production tours and tastings of Mexico's heritage spirit—educational for families learning about cultural traditions.

experiences.name: Museo Tamayo
experiences.desc: Contemporary art museum, rotating exhibitions
experiences.longDesc: This modern art museum showcases contemporary works by established and emerging artists—inspiring for families appreciating cutting-edge creative expression.

experiences.name: Museo de Arte Popular
experiences.desc: Folk art museum, traditional Mexican crafts, textiles
experiences.longDesc: This vibrant museum celebrates Mexican folk art traditions including textiles, ceramics, and crafts—colorful and inspiring for artistically-curious families.

experiences.name: Tlatelolco (Three Cultures)
experiences.desc: Archaeological site with Aztec, Spanish colonial, and modern Mexico layers
experiences.longDesc: This complex site layers pre-Hispanic Aztec ruins, Spanish colonial church, and modern plaza—visually representing Mexico's rich historical integration.

experiences.name: Mirador Pico de Orizaba
experiences.desc: Mexico's highest volcano, hiking, mountain views
experiences.longDesc: This towering volcano offers dramatic mountain hiking and panoramic views across central Mexico—inspiring for active families seeking natural grandeur.

experiences.name: Cenote Route (Riviera Maya)
experiences.desc: Multiple cenotes, swimming, snorkeling, cave exploration
experiences.longDesc: The Riviera Maya's cenote route offers multiple opportunities for swimming, snorkeling, and exploring caves—magical natural experiences children absolutely adore.

experiences.name: Xcaret Park
experiences.desc: Eco-adventure park with beach, snorkeling, ziplining, cenotes
experiences.longDesc: This comprehensive eco-adventure park combines beach, snorkeling, adventure activities, and cenote exploration—comprehensive family fun in one destination.

experiences.name: Isla Mujeres Day Trip
experiences.desc: Island getaway from Cancun, beaches, snorkeling, Caribbean vibe
experiences.longDesc: This charming island off Cancun offers pristine beaches, excellent snorkeling, and laid-back Caribbean atmosphere—perfect day trip for beach-loving families.

experiences.name: Cozumel Diving & Snorkeling
experiences.desc: World-class diving destination, reef systems, marine life
experiences.longDesc: This world-renowned diving hub features spectacular coral reefs and abundant marine life—transformative for families wanting to explore underwater Mexico.

experiences.name: Garibaldi Plaza (Mariachi Music)
experiences.desc: Historic plaza, live mariachi bands, traditional music
experiences.longDesc: This lively plaza is where authentic mariachi musicians perform—a quintessential Mexican experience that families find musically enchanting and culturally enriching.

experiences.name: Museo Nacional de Historia
experiences.desc: Mexican history museum in Chapultepec Castle
experiences.longDesc: This comprehensive history museum chronicles Mexico from pre-Hispanic times through modern era—essential for families wanting deep historical understanding.

experiences.name: Museo de Arte Moderno
experiences.desc: Modern art museum, contemporary Mexican artists
experiences.longDesc: This museum showcases contemporary Mexican artistic expression—inspiring for families appreciating modern creative vision and cultural perspectives.

experiences.name: Lucha Libre (Wrestling)
experiences.desc: Traditional masked wrestling matches, historic arena
experiences.longDesc: Mexico's iconic masked wrestling tradition combines athleticism, theater, and spectacle—entertainment that fascinates kids and adults alike.

experiences.name: Bellas Artes Palace
experiences.desc: Ornate cultural palace, performing arts, architectural marvel
experiences.longDesc: This stunning Art Deco palace showcases performing arts and architecture—cultural centerpiece that impresses families with its grandeur and significance.

experiences.name: Playa Maya Beach (Riviera Maya)
experiences.desc: Family-friendly Caribbean beach, water sports, resorts
experiences.longDesc: This expansive Caribbean beach offers calm waters, water sports, and family facilities—perfect base for Riviera Maya beach vacation relaxation.

experiences.name: Laguna Bacalar
experiences.desc: Seven-colored lagoon, cenote, kayaking, snorkeling
experiences.longDesc: This stunning lagoon features seven distinct colors, cenotes, and clear water perfect for kayaking—natural wonder that captivates everyone.

experiences.name: Kohunlich Maya Ruins
experiences.desc: Remote Maya ruins, jungle setting, pre-Hispanic agriculture
experiences.longDesc: These remote jungle ruins reveal sophisticated pre-Hispanic agricultural engineering and ceremonial architecture—mysterious and adventurous for exploratory families seeking genuine archaeological wonders.

experiences.name: Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve
experiences.desc: Protected biosphere, mangrove ecosystems, wildlife, boat tours
experiences.longDesc: This vast biosphere reserve protects unique ecosystems and wildlife—pristine nature experiences for environmentally-conscious adventuring families.

experiences.name: Aktun Chen Cave
experiences.desc: Stalactite cave, cenote, nature trail, guided tours
experiences.longDesc: This impressive cave system features dramatic stalactites, underground pools, and nature trails—geological wonder families find utterly fascinating.

experiences.name: Puerto Morelos Reef
experiences.desc: Protected reef system, snorkeling, marine sanctuary
experiences.longDesc: This protected reef offers excellent snorkeling and marine biodiversity—perfect for families wanting authentic reef encounters away from crowds.

experiences.name: Cenote Ik Kil
experiences.desc: Sacred Maya cenote, collapsed sinkhole, swimming, cultural significance
experiences.longDesc: This sacred cenote with dramatic collapsed sinkhole offers swimming and spiritual significance—profound for families interested in Maya traditions.

experiences.name: Xcel-Há Eco-Park
experiences.desc: All-inclusive eco-adventure park, lagoons, cenotes, zip-lining
experiences.longDesc: This comprehensive eco-park combines swimming, snorkeling, zip-lining, cenotes, and cultural shows—complete family adventure in one destination.

experiences.name: Yucatan Cenote Pools
experiences.desc: Multiple cenotes, variety of swimming experiences
experiences.longDesc: The Yucatán's cenote system offers dozens of swimming opportunities from crystal pools to jungle caves—endlessly enchanting for water-loving families.

experiences.name: Calakmul
experiences.desc: Remote Maya city, jungle pyramids, wildlife reserve
experiences.longDesc: This remote jungle city reveals sophisticated Maya civilization hidden within pristine forest—adventure and mystery for intrepid archaeological families.

kidFriendly.name: Chapultepec Park
kidFriendly.desc: Massive urban park with museums, zoo, castle, playgrounds
kidFriendly.longDesc: This sprawling Mexico City oasis combines world-class museums, an interactive zoo, historic castles, and playgrounds—endless discovery and play for families.

kidFriendly.name: Xel-Há Water Park
kidFriendly.desc: All-inclusive eco-adventure park with snorkeling, zip-lines, wildlife
kidFriendly.longDesc: This all-inclusive eco-adventure park lets families snorkel among tropical fish, zip-line through cenotes, and encounter wildlife—thrilling adventure for all ages.

kidFriendly.name: Xcaret Park
kidFriendly.desc: Eco-adventure park with beach, snorkeling, ziplining, cenotes
kidFriendly.longDesc: This comprehensive eco-adventure park combines beach, snorkeling, adventure activities, cenotes, and cultural shows—complete family fun in one destination.

kidFriendly.name: Playa del Carmen Beach
kidFriendly.desc: Family-friendly Caribbean beach with calm waters, activities
kidFriendly.longDesc: This spacious, family-friendly Caribbean beach offers calm waters perfect for young swimmers, plus resorts, restaurants, and water activities.

kidFriendly.name: Xplor Park
kidFriendly.desc: Adventure park with zip-lines, jeeps, cenote swimming
kidFriendly.longDesc: This thrilling adventure park combines zip-lining, underground vehicle adventures, and cenote swimming—pure excitement for active families.

kidFriendly.name: Aquarium Interactive Cancun
kidFriendly.desc: Interactive aquarium with touch pools, sea life, education
kidFriendly.longDesc: This hands-on aquarium lets kids interact with sea creatures, learn about marine ecosystems, and enjoy interactive exhibits—science comes alive for curious minds.

kidFriendly.name: Xcaret Eco Park (Kid Focus)
kidFriendly.desc: Water activities, animal encounters, cultural shows for families
kidFriendly.longDesc: This kid-optimized eco-park section features gentler water activities, animal encounters, and cultural performances—perfect for younger adventure-seekers.

kidFriendly.name: Isla Mujeres Beach
kidFriendly.desc: Peaceful island beach, calm waters, snorkeling for kids
kidFriendly.longDesc: This tranquil island beach offers calm waters perfect for young swimmers and beginner snorkelers—relaxed family beach time at its best.

kidFriendly.name: Laguna Bacalar
kidFriendly.desc: Seven-colored lagoon, kayaking, swimming, nature
kidFriendly.longDesc: This stunning natural lagoon offers safe swimming, gentle kayaking, and nature exploration—pristine family water time in paradise.

kidFriendly.name: Cenote Ik Kil
kidFriendly.desc: Sacred cenote with collapsed sinkhole, swimming, cultural significance
kidFriendly.longDesc: This dramatic cenote with 40-meter walls offers swimming and spiritual significance—unforgettable natural wonder for curious young minds.

kidFriendly.name: Zoo of Mexico City
kidFriendly.desc: Free zoo in Chapultepec Park, endangered species programs
kidFriendly.longDesc: This excellent zoo within Chapultepec focuses on Mexican and endangered species education—conservation-focused learning for environmentally-conscious kids.

kidFriendly.name: Museo Tamayo (Kid Programs)
kidFriendly.desc: Contemporary art museum with children's programming
kidFriendly.longDesc: This modern art museum offers engaging children's programs, interactive exhibits, and family-friendly exhibitions—inspiring young minds to appreciate cutting-edge creative expression and contemporary artistic vision.

kidFriendly.name: Museo de Arte Popular
kidFriendly.desc: Folk art museum with colorful textiles, crafts, workshops
kidFriendly.longDesc: This vibrant museum offers interactive craft workshops and colorful folk art exhibitions—hands-on creativity for artistic kids.

kidFriendly.name: Teotihuacán Pyramid Climbing
kidFriendly.desc: Ancient pyramids, hiking trails, archaeological learning
kidFriendly.longDesc: Climbing Teotihuacán's massive pyramids combines physical adventure with ancient history—thrilling for adventurous kids and educational for curious minds.

kidFriendly.name: Frida Kahlo Museum (Kid Tours)
kidFriendly.desc: Kid-friendly museum tours, artist biography, art appreciation
kidFriendly.longDesc: This museum offers age-appropriate tours of Frida's life and work—inspiring young minds to appreciate artistic expression and personal courage.

kidFriendly.name: Ghibli Museum (Temporary Mexico Exhibits)
kidFriendly.desc: Animation museum experiences, interactive art installations
kidFriendly.longDesc: This museum celebrates animation and interactive art—immersive creative experiences that enchant kids and inspire artistic interest.

kidFriendly.name: Xochimilco Boat Tours
kidFriendly.desc: Floating gardens, colorful boats, island exploration
kidFriendly.longDesc: These Aztec floating gardens offer colorful boat tours through island gardens and waterways—magical and enchanting for adventurous young explorers.

kidFriendly.name: Bioluminescent Bay (Puerto Escondido)
kidFriendly.desc: Glowing water phenomenon, kayaking, natural wonder
kidFriendly.longDesc: This magical bioluminescent bay glows with living light when disturbed—a mystical natural experience kids find absolutely enchanting.

kidFriendly.name: Palenque with Kid-Friendly Trails
kidFriendly.desc: Maya ruins with accessible jungle trails, family exploration
kidFriendly.longDesc: Palenque's accessible trails through jungle ruins offer adventure, archaeology, and nature exploration—perfect for active, curious kids.

kidFriendly.name: Cooking Classes for Kids (Oaxaca)
kidFriendly.desc: Hands-on Oaxacan cooking workshops for children
kidFriendly.longDesc: These interactive cooking workshops teach kids traditional Oaxacan recipes and techniques—delicious learning for food-curious families.

kidFriendly.name: Butterfly Sanctuary (Oaxaca)
kidFriendly.desc: Monarch butterfly habitat, seasonal migration, nature walks
kidFriendly.longDesc: Oaxaca's butterfly sanctuaries showcase the stunning monarch migration phenomenon—a natural wonder that captivates every young naturalist and teaches children about ecological importance and transformation.

kidFriendly.name: Cable Car rides (Guanajuato)
kidFriendly.desc: Historic cable cars over colorful cityscape, scenic views
kidFriendly.longDesc: Guanajuato's cable car rides offer thrilling views over the iconic colorful city—exciting ride and panoramic sightseeing for families.

kidFriendly.name: Mineral Museum (Guanajuato)
kidFriendly.desc: Geological specimens, mining heritage, interactive exhibits
kidFriendly.longDesc: This mineral museum showcases geological wonders and mining heritage—educational and visually stunning for geology-curious kids.

kidFriendly.name: Silver Crafting Workshops (Taxco)
kidFriendly.desc: Watch silversmiths at work, purchase handcrafted jewelry
kidFriendly.longDesc: Taxco's silversmith workshops let families observe and purchase handcrafted jewelry—cultural education combined with souvenir shopping.

markets.name: Mercado de la Merced
markets.desc: World's largest open-air market, produce, crafts, chaos
markets.longDesc: One of the world's largest open-air markets sprawls across entire blocks—overflowing with vibrant produce and local energy, a sensory feast for families.

markets.name: La Lagunilla Market
markets.desc: Historic weekend market, antiques, crafts, vintage finds
markets.longDesc: This historic weekend market is packed with vintage finds, handcrafted goods, and local character—perfect for families seeking authentic souvenirs and discovery.

markets.name: Tulum Artisan Market
markets.desc: Local crafts and souvenirs from Tulum artisans
markets.longDesc: This curated collection of locally made crafts offers families the chance to support local makers while finding beautiful, meaningful pieces to remember trips.

markets.name: Mercado Benito Juárez (Oaxaca)
markets.desc: Historic market in Oaxaca, textiles, crafts, regional foods
markets.longDesc: This vibrant market in Oaxaca's center showcases textiles, regional foods, and crafts—authentic cultural marketplace for families.

markets.name: Central de Abastos (Oaxaca)
markets.desc: Enormous traditional market, mole, mezcal, indigenous crafts
markets.longDesc: Oaxaca's massive market showcases regional ingredients, mole pastes, mezcal, and indigenous crafts—overwhelming sensory and cultural immersion.

markets.name: Mercado Benito Juárez (San Miguel de Allende)
markets.desc: Artisan market in San Miguel, local crafts, arts community
markets.longDesc: This artist-community market showcases local crafts and art—perfect for families supporting San Miguel's creative community.

markets.name: Mercado del Carmen (Puebla)
markets.desc: Historic market in colonial Puebla, regional foods, crafts
markets.longDesc: This colonial-era market showcases Puebla's regional foods, traditional crafts, and historic atmosphere—cultural centerpiece for curious families.

markets.name: Mercado Lucas de Galvez (Mérida)
markets.desc: Historic market in Mérida, Yucatán foods, textiles
markets.longDesc: This historic market showcases Yucatán's unique foods, textiles, and crafts—essential for understanding the peninsula's distinct culture.

markets.name: Mercado 20 de Noviembre (Oaxaca)
markets.desc: Traditional market with mole makers, chocolate, regional crafts
markets.longDesc: This market features artisans making mole from scratch, chocolate, and traditional crafts—working cultural heritage families can witness.

markets.name: Mercado Chapultepec (Mexico City)
markets.desc: Food market near Chapultepec, fresh produce, street food
markets.longDesc: This neighborhood market showcases fresh produce and authentic street food—perfect for families exploring Mexico City's casual food culture.

markets.name: Mercado Roma
markets.desc: Modern artisan market in Roma neighborhood, foods, crafts
markets.longDesc: This contemporary market celebrates artisanal foods and crafts from across Mexico—modern take on traditional markets for cultural exploration.

markets.name: Bazar del Sábado (San Miguel de Allende)
markets.desc: Saturday artisan market, local artists, live music
markets.longDesc: This weekend artisan market features local artists, crafts, and live music—authentic cultural gathering for adventurous shopping families.

markets.name: Mercado de Abastos (Tlaxcala)
markets.desc: Traditional market with pulque, mole, regional specialties
markets.longDesc: This traditional market showcases Tlaxcala's unique foods and pulque tradition—cultural gateway to understanding central Mexico's heritage.

markets.name: Mercado Morelos (Cuernavaca)
markets.desc: Colorful market in Cuernavaca, flowers, fruits, crafts
markets.longDesc: This vibrant Cuernavaca market displays colorful flowers, fresh fruits, and artisan crafts—charming for families exploring colonial towns.

markets.name: Plaza de las Flores (Cancun)
markets.desc: Artisan market near Cancun, local crafts, souvenirs
markets.longDesc: This tourist-friendly artisan market showcases local crafts at reasonable prices—convenient souvenir shopping for Riviera Maya families.

markets.name: Mercado Municipal (Playa del Carmen)
markets.desc: Local market with fresh foods, regional products
markets.longDesc: This authentic local market showcases fresh foods and regional products—genuine shopping experience for families avoiding tourist traps.

markets.name: Teotihuacán Artisan Market
markets.desc: Market outside pyramid ruins, local crafts, obsidian jewelry
markets.longDesc: This market just outside Teotihuacán showcases local obsidian jewelry and crafts—convenient souvenir shopping after archaeological exploration.

markets.name: Mercado de Dulces (Oaxaca)
markets.desc: Traditional sweets market, chocolate, candies, pan de muerto
markets.longDesc: This sweet shop market showcases Oaxaca's famous candy and chocolate traditions—delicious cultural experience families adore.

markets.name: Mercado Junín (Guanajuato)
markets.desc: Food market in Guanajuato, regional foods, local specialties
markets.longDesc: This Guanajuato market showcases regional foods, local specialties, and artisan crafts—cultural introduction to central Mexican gastronomy and culinary traditions for adventurous food-loving families.

markets.name: Mercado 5 de Mayo (Puerto Vallarta)
markets.desc: Beachfront market with fresh seafood, crafts, artwork
markets.longDesc: This Puerto Vallarta market combines fresh seafood and local artwork—cultural hub for Pacific coast exploring families.

markets.name: Boutique Mezcal Shops (Oaxaca)
markets.desc: Artisanal mezcal vendors, tasting, distillery selection
markets.longDesc: Oaxaca's mezcal shops offer tastings and education about Mexico's heritage spirit—perfect for families learning about regional traditions.

markets.name: Chocolate Workshops (Oaxaca)
markets.desc: Hands-on chocolate making workshops, traditional methods
markets.longDesc: These chocolate workshops teach traditional Oaxacan chocolate-making techniques using indigenous cacao and heritage methods—delicious hands-on learning for families passionate about culinary arts and cultural traditions.

markets.name: Mercado de Abastos (Merida)
markets.desc: Large traditional market, Yucatán specialty foods
markets.longDesc: This Mérida market showcases Yucatán's distinctive foods, regional products, and artisan crafts—essential for understanding the peninsula's unique culture and culinary heritage through authentic marketplace discovery.

markets.name: Artisan Textile Markets (San Cristóbal)
markets.desc: Indigenous textile markets, colorful weaving, traditional crafts
markets.longDesc: San Cristóbal's markets showcase indigenous textiles, traditional weaving techniques, and vibrant handcrafted goods—cultural immersion supporting local artisan communities and preserving indigenous artistic traditions.

markets.name: Papier-Mâché Workshops (Mexico City)
markets.desc: Folk art workshops, colorful papier-mâché crafts
markets.longDesc: These workshops teach traditional Mexican papier-mâché crafts—hands-on cultural learning families enjoy and take home as treasured souvenirs.
